subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Buddhism Without God
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Buddhism Without God.

hook.text: Is Buddhism a religion or a philosophy? It has no creator god, no prayer to a deity. Yet millions call it their faith.

buildup.text: Buddha refused to answer whether God exists. He called it an 'unanswerable question' â€” irrelevant to ending suffering.

discovery.text: This makes Buddhism unique among world religions. You can be Buddhist and atheist simultaneously.

twist.text: Yet popular Buddhism is full of gods, spirits, and rituals. Folk practices added what the founder deliberately omitted.

climax.text: Buddhism's godlessness attracts Western seekers. In Asia, it's practiced with the same devotion as any theistic faith.

punchline.text: No creator god, no divine prayer. Buddhism rewrote what religion means.

quiz.question: What did Buddha say about the existence of God?
options: He refused to answer, calling it irrelevant to suffering
